reference.shortdesc: The tt (teletype) element is typically used to apply monospaced highlighting to the content of the element. For example, for specific items such as inline code fragments, use the codeph element.

section.note: Style sheets can be used to format the tt element differently, just like any other element can be restyled. Thus, it is not the case that content in tt elements will necessarily be rendered as monospaced.

example.title: Example
example.codeblock: Make sure that the screen displays File successfully created before proceeding to the next stage of the task.
example.p: While the previous example demonstrates a potential use of tt, it might be more properly encoded using systemoutput.
